title: Let’s Talk About Pee-wee’s Playhouse
description: As a new HBO documentary explores the life of Paul Reubens, AD looks back at the design legacy of his surrealist world where decorations were his friends

title: 9 Best Cooling Mattresses of 2025, Tested by AD Editors

title: Office P&L / Studio Tngtetshiu
description: This project begins with a priority on economy—working with, rather than against, the existing spatial typologies and structural conditions. By minimizing design intervention, the intent was to underscore and reveal the latent character of the original architecture while introducing new office functions. As the new program overlays the old structural order, the original spatial qualities are not erased but reawakened.
author: Valeria Silva

title: Remanso Cultural Institute / Ultra
description: Renovating buildings with historical value is always a challenge. Respecting the history while accommodating new uses of contemporary life both instigates and fascinates us. The renovation of this 1930s house, in addition to preserving and highlighting the most significant elements of its past, aimed to adapt the spaces to their new purpose.
author: Valeria Silva

title: Inside a serene Montauk home where nature shapes design
description: Perched on a windswept bluff between Old Montauk Highway and the Atlantic Ocean, this striking beach house in Montauk, New York State, seems to vanish into the landscape. Designed by South African firm SAOTA, the home embraces its rugged coastal setting with quiet confidence, blending architecture and nature in a way that feels both intentional and effortless.
author: Erin

title: A beachside boardwalk reimagined as the spine of a modern home
description: Perched on a sloping coastal site in Australia, this striking single-storey residence by FIGR. Architecture & Design transforms the spirit of traditional beachside living into a contemporary architectural experience.
author: Erin

title: snarkitecture sculpts creamy contours into canyon-like athens burger spot
description: seating grows from the floor in Snarkitecture’s burger spot   Snarkitecture transforms an abandoned storage plot in central Athens into One Burger, a newly opened, sculptural burger spot that feels like an urban installation. Nestled within the Greek city’s historic triangle, the 80-square-meter intervention wraps rugged stone party walls with smooth, cream-toned contours.    The […] The post snarkitecture sculpts creamy contours into canyon-like athens burger spot appeared first on designboom | architecture & design magazine.
